description: This function generates a visual representation of geometric shapes and their transformations, specifically rotations. It is designed to help students understand the concept of geometric transformations, particularly rotation about a point.

educational_standards.description: Identify geometric transformations on a coordinate plane.
Given two congruent figures, describe a sequence of rotations, reflections, and translations that exhibits the congruence between them.
Identify the reflection of a geomtetric figure.
Identify the rotation of a geomtetric figure.
Identify the translation of a geomtetric figure.
Understand that a two-dimensional figure is similar to another if the second can be obtained from the first by a sequence of rotations, reflections, translations, and dilations.
Given two similar two-dimensional figures, describe a sequence of rotations, reflections, translations, and dilations that exhibits the similarity between them.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Geometric Shape Transformations
stimulus_type_specification.description: The function can draw a variety of polygons and apply specified rotations to them. It accepts a list of Polygon objects, each of which can have a specified rotation angle, rotation direction, and rotation center. The function applies the rotation to each vertex of the polygon and plots the original and transformed polygons on a coordinate grid. The function is designed to help students visualize and understand the effect of rotation transformations on geometric shapes.

details: polygons: A list of Polygon objects. Each Polygon object represents a geometric shape and contains a list of Point objects representing its vertices.
rotation_angle: The angle of rotation to be applied to the polygon. This is an optional field for each Polygon object.
rotation_direction: The direction of rotation ('clockwise' or 'counterclockwise'). This is an optional field for each Polygon object.
rotation_center: The center of rotation. This is an optional field for each Polygon object. If not specified, the origin (0,0) is used as the center of rotation.
The rotation angle must be one of the following values: -270, -180, -90, 90, 180, 270. Any other values will result in no rotation being applied.
The rotation direction must be either 'clockwise' or 'counterclockwise'. Any other values will result in no rotation being applied.
The rotation center must be a Point object. If not specified, the origin (0,0) is used as the center of rotation.
The function draws the original and transformed polygons on a coordinate grid. The grid is automatically scaled to fit all vertices of the polygons.
The function can draw multiple polygons and apply different rotations to each of them.

The visual output is affected by the input parameters in the following ways: The vertices of the polygons determine the shapes that are drawn. The rotation angle and direction determine how the shapes are transformed. The rotation center determines the point about which the shapes are rotated.
